contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} :''For other meanings see [[Diggers (disambiguation)]]'' '''The Diggers''' are a Scottish [[Brit-pop|post-Britpop]] [[powerpop]] band, with a 1997 debut [[album]], ''Mount Everest''. ==History== Members Miezitis and Moffatt had attended school together and began playing as an [[acoustic music|acoustic]] [[duet (music)|duo]] in the early 1990s. In 1991 they moved to [[Glasgow]], and added members Eslick and Ross. After a 1993 [[car crash]], the group was noticed by [[Martin Carr]] of [[The Boo Radleys]], who got them signed to [[Creation Records]]. They opened for [[Super Furry Animals]] on tour in 1997, and released their debut album for Creation, ''Mount Everest''. The band got their name from the folk tale featured in [[Billy Bragg]]'s "The World Turned Upside Down", on his 1987 album, ''Back to Basics''. ==Members== *Chris Miezitis (vocals, guitar) *Alan Moffat (vocals, bass) *John Eslick (guitar) *Hank Ross (drums) ==Discography== *''Mount Everest'' ([[Creation Records]], 1997) *''Nobody's Fool'' (Three-track CD). Includes "Nobody's Fool", "Life's All Ways" and "Here and There" (Creation Records, 1996) *''Peace of Mind'' (Three-track CD). Includes "Peace of Mind", "Tangled Web" and "Get It Together" (Creation Records, 1996) *''O.K. Alright'' (Three-track CD). Includes "O.K. Alright", "On the Line" and "Holiday Inn" (Creation Records, 1997) ==References== *[[Stephen Thomas Erlewine]] [{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p203325|pure_url=yes}} The Diggers], [[Allmusic]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Diggers, The}} [[Category:Scottish pop music groups]] {{Scotland-band-stub}}
